encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

bibl.title: Archaeology and Papyrology: Digging and Filling Holes?

series.title: Culture and History of the Ancient Near East.

bibl.title: Tradition and Transformation: Egypt under Roman Rule. Proceedings of the International Conference, Hildesheim, Roemer- and Pelizaeus-Museum, 3-6 July 2008
bibl.author: VAN MINNEN, Peter

bibl.note: A brief history of how archaeology and papyrology of Graeco-Roman Egypt grew up in tandem, followed by a tour of places in Egypt, such as Karanis, where archaeology has been especially helpful in answering or raising papyrological questions, or where texts have provided archaeologists with a clue or a challenge for interpreting the material evidence.
